long_desc.thetext:
lgi can be built against luajit (and is actually far more stable on it) so it would be nice to have.
Debian packages both in one package and it is in the AUR for other examples.

Can you explain what has to be done to 'built lgi against luajt'?
Wouldn't it suffice to simply use luajit instead of lua at run time?

(In reply to Thomas Moschny from comment #1) > Wouldn't it suffice to simply use luajit instead of lua at run time?
If Fedora used Lua 5.1 then the two versions would be inter-changable in theory but it isn't with 5.3.
> Can you explain what has to be done to 'built lgi against luajt'?
Sadly the build system isn't great but this is an example of it:
https://aur.archlinux.org/cgit/aur.git/tree/PKGBUILD?h=luajit-lgi
Just use the luajit cflags at build time and then install into the lua 5.1 directories.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 26 development cycle. Changing version to '26'.
If you don't have the time to do this feel free to add me as a co-maintainer and I can.
